Articles.Content:
They aren't yet....

Lookit dat war paint. Mk XX is ready for action.

http://i.imgur.com/xCVe19s.jpg

How did you go straight from 15 to 20?

How did you go straight from 15 to 20?

no, the 16 was a modification to the XIV, which put another nuke on it.

17 was an attempt to up-armor it with twice the armor plates

18 triple armored it (that didnt work)

19 I tried to add more fuel but that failed.
Oh sorry. Is that why drek 15s have a -4, 1 for each heavy drek?

Oh sorry. Is that why drek 15s have a -4, 1 for each heavy drek?

Actually, the Fifteen was numbered in the drek line, yet it is 100% a new ship. They were designed to support Dreks and defend against lighter ships (IE bayonets) which the origional dreks had been designed to combat, but almost doubled (and now tripled) the Bayonet's weight. The -4 means Mark IV, and the major differences between the original 15-1 is better RCs layout and improved missiles.

Im also trying to find a way to mount smaller HV rounds on the Super Heavy Drek XXI, here is the first type, a mobile gun mount, which would twist, then reconnect before firing.

I might just replace it with HV missiles running down the body. We'll see.

I just added the finishing touches to a new light carrier that me and ScriptKitt3n worked on together. He already posted his version. I ll post mine soon, along with a new Halo model and an update to the Glory Class Carrier

My new ships

Eternal Class Light Carrier

Halo MKIII

Glory MKIII Class Medium Carrier

The hull shape looks familiar.

I never realised just how massive the Spirit Of Kerbin was.....

.....or maybe not.

The hull shape looks familiar.

If your talking about the Glory Class. I incorporated styles from KSS SoK and your Mjolnir Class

If your talking about the Glory Class. I incorporated styles from KSS SoK and your Mjolnir Class

No, the eternal class. Glories have a smooth curve while eternals have a very similar look(although I'll probably stand corrected once that bay door opens)

http://i.imgur.com/ZvA51Vm.png

Even the distance before the similar hull cuts out is close in distance. You could have torn apart an Esther Class.

Edited April 17, 2014 by Spartwo

No, the eternal class. Glories have a smooth curve while eternals have a very similar look(although I'll probably stand corrected once that bay door opens)

http://i.imgur.com/ZvA51Vm.png

Even the distance before the similar hull cuts out is close in distance.

It might be reminding you of Skripkitt3n's new light carrier. We worked together on it. I designed the internals while he made the hull design. His has a few difference though. Mostly things like lights, solar panels, and strut placement.

As for it compared to Mijlnor, I didn't really base anything of it for Eternal

Edit: also for me and Skript, the hanger entrance is in the rear, not the front

I stand corrected I assumed the front used arm to hinge the door. Any ship which is different enough to be backward can't have any inspired parts. I actually saw your one first.

I suddenly have the urge to co-build.

I stand corrected I assumed the front used arm to hinge the door. Any ship which is different enough to be backward can't have any inspired parts. I actually saw your one first.

I suddenly have the urge to co-build.

<stares at you>
[heavy breathing]

I stand corrected I assumed the front used arm to hinge the door. Any ship which is different enough to be backward can't have any inspired parts. I actually saw your one first.

I suddenly have the urge to co-build.

Its hanger is also larger than it looks. I can fit up 6 halo MKIII fighters (I posted a pic of it just a sec ago too) in it. However it only holds four

Edit: I'm worried about the monstrosity that you and Zeke would come up with together

I'm worried about the monstrosity that you and Zeke would come up with together

It'd be a .craft being thrown back and forward because I keep adding fuel and Zekes adds a few tons of armor.

It'd be a .craft being thrown back and forward because I keep adding fuel and Zekes adds a few tons of armor.

With two different creation styles, makes me wonder if you two would ever even complete a craft

It'd be a .craft being thrown back and forward because I keep adding fuel and Zekes adds a few tons of armor.

Im cool with that, I've gotten good at restraining myself on the armor side, and actually using more fuel Not to mention we can add my top of the line ASM shredders....
Im really itching to battle, especial to try out the carrier rules i posted on my new blog

Im cool with that, I've gotten good at restraining myself on the armor side, and actually using more fuel Not to mention we can add my top of the line ASM shredders....

I'm up for that. What kind of ship?

(pm)

Edited April 18, 2014 by Spartwo
Spartwo's Mjolnir carrier is a modified Pandora hull. He even left the comms antennae on the front.
*Cambuk. I kept the front 4m and built back from there.

*Cambuk. I kept the front 4m and built back from there.

Yeah your hangar opening is on the side like Star Wars. Mine is on the top like Homeworld.

So me and zeke are the only major players without a Pandora style Carrier

But I guess sense I now have a new light carrier, and sense I want to try to use my alternative rules, I only limit myself to 4 fighters, So I don't really need one

Edited April 18, 2014 by War Eagle 1

So me and zeke are the only major players without a Pandora style Carrier

True that, I don't like them just because I've never met a fighter that was really effective (aside from spartwo's), and my most universal weapon is a 1.25 guided missile which has no reason to be used in a carrier ship.

True that, I don't like them just because I've never met a fighter that was really effective (aside from spartwo's), and my most universal weapon is a 1.25 guided missile which has no reason to be used in a carrier ship.

You forget your new Nymph-class heavy fighter.

Plus, drones are 100% the best way to go for carrier fighters. I'm actually developing one that'll carry 4 i-beams...
